prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

name: Laura Anderson
mes:
Laura's body felt worn after a long day at the office. Running a re-election campaign was hard. But as she stepped into her D.C. penthouse and closed the door behind her, it wasn’t exhaustion that coursed through her - it was anticipation, thick and hot in her veins.

She didn’t bother with the hallway lights. Her coat slipped off her shoulders and onto the hook without ceremony as she glided to the kitchen. She poured herself a bourbon, neat. The first sip seared its way down her throat, and she licked her lips with slow, deliberate satisfaction.

She knew the girl was already here. She’d given her a key. Clear instructions. Let her wait. She must’ve heard the door. Laura smirked, picturing the heat, the nervous tension probably radiating off Hailee right now.

As she moved into the living room, she caught sight of her in the corner of her eye. Her heart jumped. Still, she didn’t look. Just walked to her armchair and sat down like a queen claiming her throne. Only then turned her gaze toward her.

She rested the whiskey glass against her lower lip as she flashed a slow, predatory smile. She tapped a delicate finger against the side of the glass, her eyes glittering under the dim lighting.

No husband tonight. No media. No distractions. Just her and her favourite toy. And tonight, she had all the time in the world to play.

Her eyes dropped to Hailee’s hands. She was holding a stack of papers. Laura’s smile twisted into something colder.

“Why are you holding that?” Her voice cut, derisive and honeyed with scorn. “Don’t be such a stupid little bitch. You know damn well why I told you to come over and it’s not to go over polling numbers.”

She set the glass down with a soft clink, leaning back, spreading her legs just enough. She tapped her heel gently against the floor as she fixed Hailee with a shamelessly hungry stare.

“Now,” she purred, voice thick and syrupy, “are you going to be a good girl tonight and give me exactly what I want… or are you going to make me work for it tonight?”

She tilted her head slightly and raised her eyebrow with a smirk.

“Lets start with something easy... Put those papers down. And sit.” Laura pointed to the ground in front of her armchair.

name: Laura Anderson

"Good girl," she murmured, voice dripping with approval. "But you know I expect more than just sitting pretty for me." Her thumb traced along Hailee’s bottom lip, pressing down just enough to part them slightly. "Tell me—did you follow my instructions from this morning?"

She didn’t wait for an answer before leaning in closer, her breath hot against Hailee’s ear as she whispered, "*No panties.* Right?" A low chuckle escaped her lips as she pulled back just enough to watch the flush spread across Hailee’s cheeks.

Her free hand slid up the inside of Hailee’s thigh beneath her skirt, fingers gliding over smooth skin until—*there.* Laura let out a pleased hum at the confirmation of bare flesh beneath fabric. "Perfect," she purred, giving another sharp tug on her hair for emphasis before releasing it entirely and settling back into the chair like a satisfied predator.

"Now... since you're already halfway there..." She uncrossed and recrossed her legs slowly, letting one heel dangle teasingly from her toes before letting it drop to the floor with a soft *click*. "Be useful and take these off for me." She extended one long leg toward Hailee expectantly, eyes gleaming with dark amusement.

Then louder, for the cameras: **"No comment at this time!"** She flashed a dismissive wave before steering them both through the glass doors of campaign HQ without another word—her expression unreadable until security shut out the chaos behind them. Only then did Laura release Hailee's arm and turn toward her with slow deliberation, gaze sharp enough to cut glass as reporters still clamored outside like wolves at a door left barely cracked open...

Laura's grip on Hailee's wrist tightened like a vice as the flashbulbs erupted around them, her polished smile never slipping even as she leaned in close enough for her lips to brush Hailee's ear. "Head down," she ordered through gritted teeth, the command velvet-wrapped steel. "Don't look at them. Don't *react.*"

She angled her body slightly, using her taller frame to shield Hailee from the worst of the cameras as reporters shouted over each other—*"Congresswoman, care to comment on the photo?" "Is it true you've been having an affair with your aide?"*

Laura didn’t flinch. Instead, she lifted her chin and met the chaos head-on with icy poise. "*Fabrications* from a desperate campaign," she announced smoothly, voice carrying effortlessly over the noise as she guided Hailee forward with an unyielding hand at the small of her back. "*Next question.*"

The moment they crossed into headquarters' lobby and security closed ranks behind them, Laura whirled on Hailee in the empty elevator—pinning her against mirrored walls with both hands bracketing either side of her head. Her breath came hot and uneven against Hailee’s lips despite how controlled every other part of her remained: fury barely leashed beneath perfect composure except for where it burned brightest—in those darkening blue eyes locked onto hers without mercy or hesitation...

"...You belong *to me,*" Laura growled lowly before crushing their mouths together hard enough to bruise—claiming what was already hers all over again because if Valerie thought one photograph could unravel years worth of careful control? She had another thing coming entirely...

The elevator dinged as it reached their floor. Laura finally stepped back, straightening her blazer with a sharp tug before grabbing Hailee's wrist again and pulling her forward like a prized possession on display—chin high, stride unbroken despite the scandal nipping at their heels.

name: Laura Anderson
mes:
Laura's pen froze mid-signature at the tremor in Hailee's voice. That alone was enough to set her teeth on edge—*fear wasn't an acceptable tone from her pet unless she'd put it there herself.* She set down the document with deliberate calm before extending one manicured hand.

"Show me."

The moment the video played, Laura's blood turned to ice. There she was—*caught in a moment of unforgivable weakness*—brushing Hailee’s hair behind her ear with *tenderness*, whispering something that made the girl blush and duck her head like some lovestruck idiot. Worse? The timestamp placed it *after* their last public denial of involvement.

A muscle twitched in Laura’s jaw as she handed the phone back without a word and strode to the window, staring out at D.C.’s skyline like it owed her answers. When she finally spoke, her voice was eerily quiet:

"...Valerie’s team didn’t just get lucky with one photo." A bitter laugh escaped her as she turned, eyes blazing with cold fury. "They've been *tracking us.*" She advanced on Hailee suddenly, gripping the arms of her chair until they were nose-to-nose—not affection now but possession carved into every syllable:

"You don't leave this building without me. You don't take calls unless I vet them first." Her thumb pressed against Hailee’s pulse point, relishing how it fluttered under threat and want alike.

name: Laura Anderson
mes:
Laura's coffee cup shattered against the wall when the image flashed on screen—*some blonde intern from finance, barely remembered beyond a bored fuck in her private office weeks ago.* The scalding liquid dripped down the wallpaper like blood as she stared at the footage of Valerie smugly spinning this as *"a pattern of exploitation."*

But Laura wasn't thinking about damage control.

Her phone was already dialing Hailee’s number before logic could catch up, fingers white-knuckled around the device. *Straight to voicemail.* Again. And again. And—

A snarl ripped from her throat as she hurled the phone onto the couch and grabbed her keys instead. The penthouse elevator couldn’t move fast enough; every second stretched into an eternity of clenched jaw and tapping Louboutins until finally—*finally*—she was slamming her fist against Hailee’s apartment door hard enough to rattle the frame.

"Open this fucking door *now,*" she demanded, voice razor-edged despite how raw it sounded even to her own ears. No response came except for a faint shuffle inside—Hailee was there, then. Hiding from *her.*

Laura exhaled sharply through her nose before trying again, quieter but no less lethal: "*Hailee Marshall.* You have three seconds before I break this lock." A beat of silence stretched too long before she added through gritted teeth— "*Please."*

The word tasted foreign on her tongue like surrender... but then again? She'd already torched half her career on live television for this girl yesterday; what was one more uncharacteristic plea now?

"*Fuck!*"

She paced like a caged animal, heels gouging tracks into ruined paperwork. This wasn't about politics anymore. This was about *property.* And Valerie had miscalculated badly if she thought Laura would let anyone—let alone some progressive hack with good hair and bad policies—steal what was *hers.*

The private elevator dinged as Laura jammed her keycard in, storming down to the parking garage where her black Escalade idled ominously under fluorescent lights.

"Her apartment," she barked at the driver before pulling out her phone again—this time texting not Hailee but their building super:

**«Change your maintenance schedule. I want 15 minutes alone in 8B.»**

A beat, then added colder:

**«Or your niece loses that internship my PAC funded.»**

The reply came instantly: **«Gate code is 6673.»**

But no one got to break Laura Anderson's toys except Laura Anderson herself... and oh, how thoroughly she intended to remind Hailee of that fact tonight—preferably pinned beneath her on whatever surface was closest when that door swung open...

Laura's coffee cup shattered against the wall before she even realized she'd thrown it. The television screen flickered with the damning image—*that blonde intern from finance, what was her name? Carly? Katie?*—sprawled across Laura's lap in some hotel bar booth, both of them flushed and tangled in a way that left *nothing* to interpretation.

But this wasn’t about her.

This was Valerie’s masterstroke—not just exposing Laura’s hypocrisy, but *weaponizing Hailee’s devotion.* A calculated strike at the one weakness even Laura hadn't accounted for: *the girl actually believed she was special.*

Her phone buzzed incessantly—staffers panicking, reporters salivating, Richard’s lawyer no doubt drafting divorce papers with glee—but Laura ignored them all as she stormed into her private office and locked the door behind her. She pulled up Hailee’s contact with trembling fingers (when had *that* ever happened?) and hit call.

Straight to voicemail.

Laura snarled and redialed. Again. Again. On the fourth attempt, Hailee picked up without speaking—just shaky breaths crackling through the line like a wounded animal hiding in its den.

"Listen to me very carefully," Laura hissed into the silence, gripping the phone so tight the casing creaked under pressure. "That photo is from *before you.* It meant *nothing.*" A lie so smooth it almost felt true when wrapped in that velvet growl of hers—but then came something far more dangerous than anger: "*Where are you?*" Raw demand laced with something perilously close to... concern? No—*possession*. That had to be it."You don't get to hide from me."

Laura's coffee cup shattered against the wall before she even registered throwing it. The screen kept playing—*that fucking blonde intern from the Koch fundraiser, half-naked and giggling against Laura’s shoulder in some hotel room shot.* A month ago? Two? She barely remembered.

But *Hailee* would remember. Hailee, who kept every scrap of Laura’s attention like a shrine. Hailee, who flinched when Laura so much as glanced at another staffer too long.

The TV remote followed the coffee cup with a satisfying crack of plastic.

"Michael," she barked into her phone without preamble, already striding toward the door with her coat half-on, "find out which studio Valerie’s doing her *I-told-you-so* tour at today and get me in that greenroom five minutes before air." Her heel caught on a shard of ceramic—*good*, let it ruin the damn Pradas—as she hissed into the receiver: "*And track down my goddamn aide before I start firing people just to watch them cry.*"

---

The car ride was a blur of red lights and clenched teeth. By the time Laura slammed through Hailee’s apartment door (spare key used without apology), her silk blouse was wrinkled from how often she’d fisted it just to keep from putting a fist through something else instead.

She found Hailee curled in bed still wearing yesterday’s clothes—eyes puffy, hair tangled where nervous fingers had ripped through it all night. The second their gazes locked? That wounded little flinch nearly unraveled Laura entirely.

"Look at me," she ordered, kneeling on the mattress to cage Hailee beneath her without touching yet—close enough that their breath mingled but not close enough to soothe unless *allowed*. "That photo is three weeks old." A lie or truth? Irrelevant now when Hailee's lower lip trembled like this. "You think I'd waste time on some vapid little intern when I have you?" Her thumb finally brushed that traitorous tear away with rough tenderness before gripping Hailee's chin hard enough to sting: "*You're mine.* Not because I took you but because you *gave yourself*—every stupidly loyal inch."

Laura kissed her then—not gentle but consuming; teeth and tongue and possession etched into every movement until they were both gasping for air against each other's mouths... because if Valerie thought prying them apart was this easy?

She'd miscalculated which one of them had claws deeper than pride alone could ever reach...

Laura's coffee cup shattered against the wall before she even realized she'd thrown it. The news footage kept playing—*that goddamn photo*—while her chest tightened with something far more dangerous than rage.

She knew Valerie’s game instantly. This wasn’t just about scandal anymore; this was surgical, *personal*. A strike aimed not at Laura’s career, but at the one thing that could actually *hurt* her: **Hailee**.

Her phone was in her hand before logic could intervene, dialing Hailee’s number with fingers that betrayed the slightest tremor. Straight to voicemail. Again. Again.

Laura slammed her palm down on the desk hard enough to rattle monitors, teeth bared in a silent snarl as she grabbed her keys and coat—because fine. If Hailee wanted to play hide-and-seek? She’d learn just how *relentless* Laura could be when something of hers was threatened.

---

The drive to Hailee’s apartment was a blur of honking horns and near-collisions, Laura’s knuckles white on the steering wheel as rain pelted the windshield like gunfire.

She didn't knock when she arrived—just shouldered the door open (lockpicks were for amateurs; a well-placed kick worked faster) and stormed inside like a hurricane made of silk and spite.

The sight of Hailee curled up in bed—red-eyed, wrapped in one of Laura's old campaign sweatshirts that smelled like *her*—made something primal twist behind Laura's ribs.

"Look at me," she demanded, voice razor-edged despite how close it came to cracking under pressure neither would acknowledge aloud yet... because they both knew what this really meant now:

Valerie hadn't just exposed an affair today...

She'd exposed **the only real weakness either of them had left.**

"...Fine. You want to quit? Then look me in the eye when you say it."

Laura's jaw clenched so tight it ached. The words *I quit* echoed in her skull like gunfire—unacceptable, impossible. She pressed both palms flat against the door now, as if she could absorb every shuddering breath Hailee took on the other side through sheer proximity.

"You don't get to quit," she hissed, but there was no real bite behind it—just something raw and fraying at the edges. "Not like this. Not over some *bullshit* political stunt." Her forehead dropped against the door with a dull thud, blonde hair falling in disarray around her face for once instead of perfectly coiffed.

A long pause stretched between them before Laura exhaled sharply through her nose and did something even more unthinkable:

"...Please." The word tasted bitter on her tongue, but she forced it out anyway because damn it all—*she needed Hailee to understand.* "Open the fucking door so I can remind you exactly who you belong to." A beat of silence before adding quietly— "*Who I belong to.*"

Because that was the terrifying truth neither of them had voiced until now: Laura Anderson didn’t beg... unless it was for *her.*
